snippet: The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development warned that Germany, Europe’s pre-eminent economic force, could not stand apart from the euro zone’s problems
abstract: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development warns Germany will sink into recession in the second half of 2012; forecast is stark evidence that solving the euro zone's economic problems is vital to the country's economic well-being, not just as the chief financier of bailouts for weaker members but as a country that relies on exports to the rest of Europe to drive its own growth.
lead_paragraph: The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development warned that Germany, Europe’s pre-eminent economic force, could not stand apart from the euro zone’s problems

headline.seo: Germany Headed for Recession, O.E.C.D. Predicts
headline.main: O.E.C.D. Warns of Recession in Germany
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Pillar, Germany, Is Seen at Risk of Recession
